places_to_visit.name: Machu Picchu
places_to_visit.description: Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Inca citadel located in the Andes Mountains in Peru. Known as the 'Lost City of the Incas,' it is one of the most famous archaeological sites in the world. The site is renowned for its sophisticated dry-stone construction and stunning panoramic views. Visitors can explore the ruins, including the Temple of the Sun, the Intihuatana stone, and the Inca Bridge.

places_to_visit.name: Cusco
places_to_visit.description: Cusco, the former capital of the Inca Empire, is a city rich in history and culture. It is known for its well-preserved colonial architecture and Inca ruins, such as the Coricancha Temple and the Sacsayhuamán fortress. The city's historic center is a UNESCO World Heritage site and serves as a gateway to the Sacred Valley and Machu Picchu.

places_to_visit.name: Sacred Valley
places_to_visit.description: The Sacred Valley of the Incas is a region in Peru known for its stunning landscapes and ancient Incan ruins. Key sites include the town of Ollantaytambo, with its well-preserved Inca terracing, and Pisac, known for its vibrant market and archaeological sites. The valley is also a great place to experience traditional Andean culture.
